name: Okta Errors
title: Okta Errors
body:
Exception categories

  1. Client exceptions: Exceptions that occur on the client and can be handled by code that is running on the client. These are mostly workflow/synchronization related errors.
    E.g. a user cannot be create on Okta side

  2. Login exceptions with context: These are errors that occur while a user is not handle by our own application code anymore. This are errors that happen while a user is redirected, after a user provided credentials or while a user is redirected back to our applications.
    E.g. a wrong scope is picked when redirecting a user to the Okta login

  3. Login exceptions without context: These errors are similar to the “Login exceptions with context” but Okta is not able to redirect a user back to our applications and will show it’s own error page.
    E.g. there is no redirect back to our application configured in the redirect to Okta

Example exception URL's

No Redirect URI

https://okta.testback.com/oauth2/ausog0bep2mtm7gKd0h7/v1/authorize?client_id=0oaoq91o552FIxg3A0h7&nonce=AYx1j79hkGTnJ7FlOIMqh2teti9ee0i9sCwePnJuLqR55QxUqHw1yieGn30taqfY&response_mode=fragment&response_type=code&state=p7bKuF4UcgnzQzaKToq2NTiUNopca89uMWPzTROVJbnNluyC5ekgfTNAZuYZ5GhH&scope=openid email profile

Wrong Redirect URI

https://okta.testback.com/oauth2/ausog0bep2mtm7gKd0h7/v1/authorize?client_id=0oaoq91o552FIxg3A0h7&nonce=AYx1j79hkGTnJ7FlOIMqh2teti9ee0i9sCwePnJuLqR55QxUqHw1yieGn30taqfY&redirect_uri=http%3A%2F%2FWRONG%2FREDIRECT%2FURI&response_mode=fragment&response_type=code&state=p7bKuF4UcgnzQzaKToq2NTiUNopca89uMWPzTROVJbnNluyC5ekgfTNAZuYZ5GhH&scope=openid email profile

Missing State

https://okta.testback.com/oauth2/ausog0bep2mtm7gKd0h7/v1/authorize?client_id=0oaoq91o552FIxg3A0h7&nonce=AYx1j79hkGTnJ7FlOIMqh2teti9ee0i9sCwePnJuLqR55QxUqHw1yieGn30taqfY&redirect_uri=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%2Fiam%2Fadmin%2Fauth%2Flogin&response_mode=fragment&response_type=code&scope=openid email profile

Wrong scopes

https://okta.testback.com/oauth2/ausog0bep2mtm7gKd0h7/v1/authorize?client_id=0oaoq91o552FIxg3A0h7&nonce=AYx1j79hkGTnJ7FlOIMqh2teti9ee0i9sCwePnJuLqR55QxUqHw1yieGn30taqfY&redirect_uri=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%2Fiam%2Fadmin%2Fauth%2Flogin&response_mode=fragment&response_type=code&state=p7bKuF4UcgnzQzaKToq2NTiUNopca89uMWPzTROVJbnNluyC5ekgfTNAZuYZ5GhH&scope=profile

 

Correct link for further customizations

https://okta.testback.com/oauth2/ausog0bep2mtm7gKd0h7/v1/authorize?client_id=0oaoq91o552FIxg3A0h7&nonce=AYx1j79hkGTnJ7FlOIMqh2teti9ee0i9sCwePnJuLqR55QxUqHw1yieGn30taqfY&redirect_uri=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%2Fiam%2Fadmin%2Fauth%2Flogin&response_mode=fragment&response_type=code&state=p7bKuF4UcgnzQzaKToq2NTiUNopca89uMWPzTROVJbnNluyC5ekgfTNAZuYZ5GhH&scope=openid email profile

 

Okta specific Errors

Okta provides error code for errors that occur on Okta side. Documentation for these errors can be found using the following link:

https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/error-codes/#example-errors-listed-by-error-code

Protocol Errors

Okta will show OAuth2/OpenID-Connect error-codes in case a request has an error with regards to the procotol/flow.

These kinds of errors will be sent back to the application that initialized the login flow if possible.

See:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-5.2
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-4.1.2.1
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-4.2.2.1
https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#AuthError
